name: E.R. (2009) Líbano Beritus
additionalNotes:
"Beritus" is the Phoenician name of the Capital of Lebanon. This ancient city was built in the 15th century before Christ, since then it was a landmark in its regions. It was the Capital of the Phoenicia trade empire and the ships of the old Phoenicians called on every port of antiquity.
Ramon Allones Beritus was specially chosen by Habanos sa in 2009 to offer exclusively to the Middle East. These habanos are manufactured with selected leaves of the world’s best tobacco comprising a special production of 3000 numbered boxes containing 25 cigars.
